reviewText: It's amazing how much Josh McDowell went through in his younger life. It bought tears to my eyes to watch his transformation. And now he touches so many lives. I enjoyed this movie so much that I'm looking for his books to read. Josh McDowell, you are an inspiration!

reviewText: Anger, Sorrow, Pain, Disappointment, Adversity, Sexual Abuse, Reconciliation, Victory!  Undaunted: The Early Life of Josh McDowell contains all of these elements. Most of us have experienced one or more in our lives. The struggle of Josh McDowell to disprove the resurrection or Christ leads to a decision that will change his life, and the lives of countless others. A must see!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This movie is the story of the early years of Josh McDowell.  Despite the scars of his past, Josh overcame his anger and depression. Through the restoration through his newborn faith Josh took something bad and created something good as the healing began. This is a must see for anyone who has faced physical or sexual abuse in their past.  This is a must see for anyone who has had to deal with alcoholism in their past or in their own lives.  This is a must see for anyone who is hurting. This is a Celebrate Recovery Movie for anyone with hurts, hang ups, and habits.  This movie will inspire and encourage.  Don't pass this one up.  It is well worth the watch. It may even change your life.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I was just blown away!  The film itself is not a cinematic blockbuster, but the story really got me. The quality is that of or better than any documentary you might see on the history channel. It is a well told, well-directed, true-life story of Josh McDowell. He actually narrarates it. There are actors portraying the people who really existed in his life. And all of them (the actors)  do a fine job. I had never heard of Josh McDowell and had no idea what would story would unfold, but I am so glad this story came my way.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Anyone with doubts about the existence of God should earnestly search for truth. Watching this movie is a start. I used to be agnostic. But I was determined to find truth and I found it by studying The Bible and Creationism. It takes more faith to be atheist and an evolutionist than to believe in the Creator of the universe.  Compelling testimonies are undeniable of the power of God as well. It's not about religion. It's a relationship with our Heavenly Father, the only father in the world that is perfect whether we understand or not. And it's a relationship with our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ.
summary: Must see! How can anyone deny the power of God?!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This movie jumped out at me as being a must have, but after I watched it, I promptly tucked it in my "don't watch again" stack.  Don't get me wrong, I've been blessed by Josh McDowell and his testimony, but most of this movie is about his lost life.  Only a few minutes at the end of the film address his saved life.  The problem is that Josh McDowell's lost life is very disturbing, and this movie just didn't handle the facts carefully enough.  Mr. McDowell was sexually abused as a child, and that part of his life in this film was shockingly disturbing.  Even a child could tell what was going on it's so obvious, right down to the sound of his pants zipper being pulled down.  It's really too much for us.  The movie might have been worth it if as much attention was given to his saved life as to his lost life, but that's not how it went.  If you want to see a good move about a lost man who got saved, I recommend "The Pistol:The Birth of a Legend" about Pete Mavorich.  Be sure to get the inspirational version so that you can hear his testimony at the end.
summary: Tell Me the Story of the New Creation!

reviewText: In the beginning I expected more, so I didn't finish it. Later I tried it again and was amazed at how good it is! I had no idea. I knew he was an Atheist for years, and how he became a Christian and wrote "More Than A Carpenter." But oh my, I had no idea his life was so bad. Some of it is hard to watch, but so worth it. I have loved and respected him for years, but now I understand..........Watch it!

reviewText: Josh McDowell's true story is a wonderful testimony of how someone can sincerely be seeking the truth and it will set a person free from an abusive past by becoming a new creation in Christ Jesus.  What an amazing, inspirational story of how an unhappy, angry atheist became a loving, forgiving Christian that went on to share this transformation with the world.  Josh McDowell shows us all that if he can do it, we can, too, when we accept Jesus into out hearts.  God Bless Josh McDowell!

reviewText: This presentation of the life of Josh McDowell is both disconsolate and uplifting. It clearly demonstrates the power of forgiveness.

reviewText: Many have been down this ugly road. There is always hope for the brokenhearted and this testimony speaks on the sovereignty of our Creator. the scene where this young guy comes to his fathers house is one that stood out for me. the father was broken internally in pieces seen his son physically (temporary) handicapped. this was his breakpoint. Many will be changed by these experiences in life. I would recommend this movie to adults. Very realistic of what many live and who are too afraid to open up.

reviewText: Thank you Mr. Mcdowell for being willing to share your life story with all its pathos, suffering, ugliness, hope, salvation and new life in Christ.  The 50's and 60's were recapturedA  with great accuracy.  A family or a life without Jesus is a pathetic thing indeed.
